original_title: The Fable of Higher Education That Was Too High for the Old Man
overview: Buchanan Bartlett, shiftless son of Hiram Bartlett, farmer retired, is sent to college to learn things. Father becomes peeved when he receives a bill of expenditures a month later from his son, amounting to two hundred and fifty dollars. The old man decides to investigate things, and the following day finds him at the university.
title: The Fable of Higher Education That Was Too High for the Old Man
